sentences: Jesús Castillo Monterroso (1877-1946) was a Guatemalan composer.
He was the first musician to collect a sizable amount of Guatemalan folk music, which he later used in works such as his opera Quiché Vinak, as well as ouvertures and symphonic poems.
His piano music, as well as his orchestral output, reflects the fusion of his contemporary art with Mayan mythology such as legends and myths from the Popol Vuh.
The national youth orchestra of Guatemala, the Orquesta Sinfónica Jesús Castillo (established in 1997), was named in his honor.
Diccionario de la Música Española e Hispanoamericana, 10 vols., ed.
Madrid: Sociedad General de Autores y Editores, 2000, 6/1-11.
Free scores by Jesús Castillo (composer) at the International Music Score Library Project (IMSLP)
